fields.description:
h3. To reproduce:
* Start a standalone confluence {code}atlas-run-standalone --product confluence --version 5.6.6{code}
* go to http://localhost:1990/confluence/display/ds/Welcome+to+the+Confluence+Demonstration+Space
* log in as admin:admin
* click Tools -> Restrictions
* add restrictions for confluence-administrators, confluence-users, admin
* click "Save"
* click Tools -> Page Information

h3. what happens
* Page restrictions are displayed, but one of them (the first one that was set?) is displayed as created by "Anonymous" (see screenshot)
* this is not a display problem, the {{CREATOR}} field in the database for the corresponding {{CONTENT_PERM}} is {{NULL}}

h3. what is expected instead
* all page restrictions should be reported to be created by "admin" (because they were)
fields.summary: Creator of a page restriction is not set for the first page restriction that is applied

fields.description:
*Steps to Replicate*
# Install confluence 5.6.4
# Create a page and save it
# Import the the word document attached into this ticket into the confluence page

h6. Observed Behavior
Can't see the image clearly and read the wordings

h6. Expected Behavior
User should be able to see the image clearly
fields.summary: Images in Word documents resized on Import word document
Wrong timezones for all Russian cities and Belarus as well.

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to "Confluence Administrator Page" > "Configure Code Macro" under "Configuration" on the left panel of the page.
# Click "Add a new language" and upload a JS file that has the same brush name as one of the brushes available in Code Block macro's syntaxes, e.g. {code}SyntaxHighlighter.brushes.Java = Brush;{code}
# Click "Add". You'd noticed that a successful notification will be shown identifying that the new language has been added successfully.
# Add a Code Block macro on a page and try to search for the newly added language. 
# The newly added language won't be listed in the Syntax Highlighting list. 

\\
The following error is thrown in the {{<Confluence-Home>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log}}, that indicates that the new language was failed to be added into the list of languages available in the Code Block macro.
{noformat}

fields.summary: Misleading successful notification was shown for Code Block macro "Add a New Language" feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37456].
  {panel}

Looking at my task list in 
https://-HOSTNAME-/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action

One of the page links gives a Page Not found response. 

This is because the page uses the pageId=xxx query parameter due to the page title (contains a slash). Unfortunately the task list appends a query parameter with ?focusedTaskId=yyy and assumes that they page link does not already have a query parameter. Thus the link ends up with to ? characters

https://-HOSTNAME-/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2454034594?focusedTaskId=6

which gives a page not found.
fields.summary: Task listing can be broken

fields.description:
It's been observed that when upgrading past 5.4.4, the StorageToAoMigration upgrade task can take a long time. In at least one instance, it was observed that a single page with many versions (~500) and many tasks (~250) was holding up the task.

This hasn't been replicated, but I'm raising this bug report as a placeholder in case others run into the same issue so we can consolidate the investigation here.

*What we know:*
* [Multiple users have seen similar symptoms|https://community.atlassian.com/questions/12282653/should-confluence-5.4.4-to-5.6.6-upgrade-migration-take-hours].
* It seems to consistently take about 2.5 seconds to migrate each task
fields.summary: StorageToAoMigrationUpgradeTask takes a long time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37452].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence 5.8 OD will not startup, as it comes with Java 7 JRE embedded and set as the default

h3. Environment

h3. Notes
* I looked into what JRE is included and the notes indicate it is Java 7

h3. Workaround
# Install Java 8
# Go to <confluence_install>/bin
# Edit setenv.sh (or modify tomcat7w in Windows)
# Remove the JRE_HOME line and replace with {code}export JAVA_HOME=/path/to/java/8{code}
# Start Confluence

fields.description:
We are having a problem where our Confluence instance is still sending notifications to users who have disabled accounts.

When we share a page with a group - it sends the notification to all users in that group, whether they have active or disabled accounts.

Thanks,
Daniel

fields.summary: On setup, if you neglect to set conf.home in confluence-init.properties you get a stack trace rather than a message informing you of your mistake

fields.description:
In the Multimedia macro, we have the option to edit the Width and the Height for a video to be displayed. However, depending on the size that you select, the fullscreen option may not be displayed.

For example, setting the Width to 215%, it will not display the content properly:

!width.png!

For minor sizes of the width, the fullscreen option will be removed at all.
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro - Fullscreen Option not Available with specific Width in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37446].
  {panel}

Depending on the size that you adjust the Multimedia macro width, it will display a button to make the video to go fullscreen:

!screen.png!

However, instead of having the macro going fullscreen, we have the browser facing the change and the mp4 video will not render at all:

fields.description:
*Bug Description*

When user try to insert an anchor link at "Insert Link" >> "Advance" to point to an anchor with a name that contain "&" character, Confluence will automatically encode the "&" character to "&". This leads to the need of changing it manually to & for the user.

*How to Replicate The Bug*

# Create an anchor and name it "Test & Bug"
# Create an anchor link to point to the previously created anchor

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should input the "Link Text" as is without any automatic conversion.

*Resulted Behaviour"

Confluence automatically converted link "{{Test & Bug}}" to "{{Test & Bug}}" as can be seen in the screenshot below:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-05 at 10.29.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confluence Automatically Encode "&" Character to XML Encoding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37444].
  {panel}

*Bug Description*

When "Page Properties Report" macro returned list that are more than the "Number of items to display" (which by default is 30), it won't be able to refresh the content when user toggle in between the page list.

*How to replicate the bug*

# Create 30 pages that contain page properties macro
# Create a page properties macro with "Number of items to display" set to 20 (or a number that makes the table larger than the browser window height)
# Save the page
# "Page Properties Macro" should provide 2 pages of list to list down the page properties macro data
# Click the page "2" button in the "Page Properties Report Macro"
# Click the page "1" button in the "Page Properties Report Macro" to go back to the previous list

*Expected Behaviour*

"Page Properties Report" macro should be able to listed the data on both pages of list without issue

*Resulted Behaviour*

"Page Properties Report" macro unable to render the second page of list and when user click "1" to retrieve the previous page list, the macro unable to return the data. This probably means that the javascript that render the page list failed when user toggle in between page list.

*Notes:*

The problem appears when the table is larger than the browser viewport.

*Workaround*

Make sure the value of "Number of items to display" is higher than the total of page properties that it will returned. This workaround does not solve the issue in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: "Page Properties Report" macro unable to render the content when it returned multiple pages of list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37442].
  {panel}

These are the questions I’d like to get to someone who knows Confluence well, either internally or at Atlassian.

1.	What is the functionality of labels/tags?  It seems I can tag a page to a label or tag a question to a label, but can I do a search against labels that will return me both?  For example, can I search for the label “Excel” and “Business Logic” and get back all of the pages and questions that are tagged with either/both?
2.	Can I control who can make labels and who can’t?  I want to enforce a certain amount of governance around this and don’t want the labels to devolve into a hairball of everyone making up new labels like high school kids make up new hashtags.

Thanks,
Emir

fields.description:
In the current *System Information* page in Confluence, the Properties for *PermGen* memory in use are shown. While this works fine with Java 1.7, Java 1.8 has deprecated the use of PermGen as a parameter, instead utilising *MaxMetaSpaces* which are supposedly dynamically allocated. Given this fact, our System Information Page will be out of date for Java 1.8 and should be updated to actually pull meaningful data and not show its age by attempting to call PermGen when that is no longer in use with Java 1.8.

Currently, clients running Java 1.8 still see that parameter, but it always shows as 100% free, because it does not exist.
fields.summary: System Information Page needs to reflect Java 8 parameters

Using Chrome {{Version 42.0.2311.90 (64-bit)}}, the only files that seem to work when using the Multimedia Macro on Confluence are .mp3 and .mp4 files. 

.mov, .wma, .ram, .avi and .mpg do not work for Chrome.

Using Firefox {{36.0}} and Safari {{Version 8.0.5 (10600.5.17)}}, .mp3, .mp4, .mpg and .mov files work.

.wma, .ram and .avi do not work for Firefox and Safari.

See: [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Multimedia+Macro]

fields.description:
The copy and paste table row / column functions in the editor toolbar stop working when local storage is full. A QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR can also be seen in the JS console.

Ideally, these should fall back to storing the content in memory when local storage is full. We should also update the call from {{AJS.storageManager.setItem}} to {{AJS.storageManager.setItemQuietly}}.

h4. How to tell if you are impacted by this bug

1. Open your JavaScript console in the editor (View > Developer > JavaScript console in Chrome)
2. Cut a table row or column and look for a {{QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR}} message in the console

h4. Workaround (instructions for Chrome)

1. View > Developer > Developer Tools > Application > Storage
2. Expand Local Storage section and select the URL of the Confluence instance where you encountered this issue
3. Clear some local storage entries, you may want to start with those with the {{atlassian.editor}} prefix
fields.summary: Copying a table row or column should fall back to storing content in memory if local storage is full

fields.description:
Automatic user synchronization from a remote directory (when a Synchronisation Interval is set) stops working when manual Synchronisation is run.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Configure a remote directory (Crowd or LDAP)
# Define a Synchronisation Interval (e.g. 5 minutes).
# Check it is running according to schedule.
# Click *Synchronise now*.
{code}2015-05-01 23:03:18,358 INFO [scheduler_Worker-8] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchroniseCache FULL synchronisation complete for directory [ 98306 ] in [ 201ms ]
{code}
# Wait for the Synchronisation Interval again. It won't run.

*Workaround*

To have it working again, it is necessary to Edit the User Directory and set the Synchronisation Interval again.
fields.summary: Automatic user synchronization stops if manual synchronization is performed

Muti-byte characters (ex: Japanese) are displayed as English despite transfering by MS IME in the following environment.

*Environment*
* Windows7 & IE11
* Microsoft Office IME 2010

*How to reproduce* 
# Microsoft IME set Japananese mode. [^IME_1.png]
# Create or edit a page in Confluence.
# Add the page layout.
# Add Section macro within the page layout.
# Can't enter Japanese characters, they can't transfered and displayed in English. [^IME_2.png]

If we use the other browsers(Chrome,Firefox..) or the other IMEs (Google), the phenomenon doesn't occur.

When our customer go to backup manager they are finding the following recommendation:
!backupManager.PNG|thumbnail!
That is not correct at all and causes great friction during the migration, if a customer tries to import a Confluence cloud backup into any confluence between version 5.3 and 5.7.0 it will fail due the missing attachments reference in the content table.

Customer should first download the Confluence OD version and then once we release the next major version upgrade Confluence to that version as described in below Page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37403].
  {panel}

Situation:

- I have two pages in two different spaces.
- Page A (in space 1) has an include page macro of Page B (in space 2). 
- On page B I have several attached images. I go and do a space export of the space 1 that contains just Page A with its inclusion of Page B. 
- The content of Page B shows up on A but none of the attachments show up.

What happens here is that the XML backup doesn't map the content attached in different spaces but integrated to the space which you are performing the backup.

Would be useful to have this functionality
fields.summary: Include attachments from other Spaces in a XML backup

fields.description:
If we have a plugin using the lucene-sort-mapper, when switching nodes we get the following exception:

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot retrieve plugin module before it is enabled: PluginModuleHolder[(unknown; not enabled)]
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.module.PluginModuleHolder.getModule(PluginModuleHolder.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.search.AbstractLuceneMapperModuleDescriptor.getModule(AbstractLuceneMapperModuleDescriptor.java:58)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

The workaround is enabling and disabling the plugin in the other node which fixes it until the next use of the lucene-sort-mapper which will break it again. 

I've create a simple component that fires the PluginEnabledEvent which makes it work, but this should be fixed on Atlassian's side.

Please find attached the full stacktrace plus the test component that I used to fix it.

We've disabled this feature and will be waiting for a fix from Atlassian to re-enable it.
fields.summary: [DATA CENTER] lucene-sort-mapper is not working on multiple clusters

fields.description:
When a search contains more than 1000 results, only the first 100 pages can be accessed.
When switching to page 101 (startIndex=1000), the result page shows "no results found".  This issue is also present in the RestAPI.   Using the RestAPI, when there are over 1000 results, once the startIndex reaches 1000, Confluence returns zero results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Perform a search in Confluence that returns 1000+ results.
# Page through the results by clicking page 100 or changing the StartIndex value in the URL to 1000. 

h3. Expected Results
Additional search results display.

h3. Actual Result

A message "No results found for confluence. Please try one of the following suggestions:
Use more general search terms or consult the online documentation for tips.
If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter" is received. 

See attachments.

h3. Notes

This behavior is by design. There is system property confluence.search.max.results that limits the number of pages returned in any search query. The default value is 1000. 

h3. Workaround

[Modify|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties] the [Java system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recognised+System+Properties] {{confluence.search.max.results}} e.g. -Dconfluence.search.max.results. Changing {{1000}} to {{2000}} will increase the number of pages returned to 2000
fields.summary: Search returns 0 results after reaching StartIndex=1000
Can't import the confluence site

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37397].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On Confluence 5.7 with configured SMTP server:
# User A Create a page
# User B watch the page
# User A upload an attachment to the page using Attachments Macro
# User B does not receive notification

h3. Suggested Solution
User B should receive notification from changes made using Attachments Macro.
 
h3. Workaround 
Upload attachments using Edit Mode on page; user will naturally receive notifications.
fields.summary: No notification received when adding attachment via Attachments Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37396].
  {panel}

We have launched Confluence as a self-help documentation to our enterprise (abt 10.000 users)
At this point we have launched with 60 pages, but expect this space to quickly grow. 

We welcome feedback and questions from our audience.
The team of technical writers is looking for a way to view all inline comments in one combined way. At this point we rely on email notifications and a manual page that brings all feedback together in one place. It is unrealistic to expect that we would review each pages for unresolved inline comments

We love inline comments and hope that this feature would be included for the management of inline comments of large public spaces going forward.
fields.summary: As a technical writer, I would like to see all unresolved inline comments for a space, in order to effectively manage reviews

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Apache as a proxy in front of Confluence, and using the SSL connector in Apache, some functions in Confluence can cause Apache with SSL to stop responding (Confluence is still running behind the scenes).


h3. Environment
* Apache HTTP Server
** Default LimitRequestLine (set to 8190)
** SSL configured in Apache 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.7.x
# Create a page with a Roadmap macro
# Add 20 bars to the roadmap (this is in addition to the default 3 bars)
# Click insert
# Click save

h3. Expected Results
The page loads in Confluence and is served through Apache to the user

h3. Actual Results
The page loads in Confluence (I confirmed this through profile logging), but is not served through Apache (the user is unable to access the server for a period of roughly 10 minutes after this failure)
The following appears in the https_error_log:
{code}[Mon Apr 27 14:09:23 2015] [error] [client xx.xxx.xxx.xx] request failed: URI too long (longer than 8190){code}
 
h3. Notes
It looks like this issue can be fixed by switching to POST instead of GET when loading pages like this (the large amount of objects in the roadmap is passed through the GET and caused the issue in Apache)

h3. Workaround
Add a line to the virtual host file to increase the LimitRequestLine from the default of 8190. Doubling the value should be a good start.
fields.summary: Certain functions in Confluence, eg Roadmap, can cause Apache with SSL to stop responding

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37387].
  {panel}

Hi there,

Currently we only record Thread name, Username, URL ,VM free memory at start of request (in KB), Change in free memory after request is finished (in KB), Time taken for request (in ms),  Remote address , Login Failures - "recordLoginFailure" in access logging.

It would be great if user's comment and download files can be logged in to the access logging as well

When a user commented or download attachment on a page, it shall recorded in the log together with the comment's text and the timestamp of the occurence.
fields.summary: Include user's comment/download to access log

fields.summary: Crash when I upload an attachment with a special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37385].
  {panel}

JIRA issues macro are not refreshing automatically. They just refresh after manually refreshing or flushing the cache in Confluence. Affects JIRA Macros 5.6.11.

h3. Workarounds
# Go to Admin > Cache Statistics, and Flush All
# Manually refresh the macro on the page.
fields.summary: REGRESSION - JIRA issue macro aggressively caches, new issues take a while to appear in the issues macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37381].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary***
Content Report Table Macro cannot sort based on *Title* with some combinations of numeric titles.

h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Create Meeting Notes with the below combination at the begining of the title
{panel}
00-00-000 (/)
00-00-00 (/)
00-00 (/)
00-0000-00 (/)
00*00*0000 (/)
0000*00*00 (/)

00-00-0000 (x)
0000-00-00 (x)
{panel}
# Go to Meeting Notes root page
# Try to sort by title

h3. ***Expected behaviour***  
Content Report Table Macro should be able to be sorted based on *Title* with for all combinations of numeric titles.
fields.summary: Content Report Table Macro cannot sort based on Title

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* search for something using Livesearch macro box
* click on one result
* press the browser's back button (like you would do if it wasn't what you were looking for)

Here we'd expect to get back to the search results page; instead one of the following two things happens:
* you land on a search results page you'd get when searching for * (i.e. all pages)
* you get an error message (update page)
fields.summary: Back Button "misbehaves" after LiveSearch

fields.description:
When using "Import Office Word" macro to import a word document containing a table, the default table border (solid, 1 pixel wide) gets converted to an HTML solid border with a width of 0.5px.

When viewed under Chrome 42.0.2311.90m the table borders will not get rendered because anti-aliasing collapses their width to 0.

To view the border, a user needs to zoom to 150% or change the CSS style from {{width: 0.5px}} to {{width: 1px}}

Suggested fix: increase the border width to {{1px}}.
fields.summary: Word Import fails to render table borders
Option to Confirm Plugin Upgrades

fields.description:
h3 Symptoms
Confluence 5.5
I have a page with Content by label
my label has a / character
RiskFoundation/ongoingSpecs
It shows a list of 6 items on my page
It says there are 17 more

"
Architecture Componentization
Page:
Audit Tables
Page:
Data Quality after imports BI App
Page:
How to work collaboratively on RiskFoundation Platform
Page:
List Settings
Page:
Load Results
17 related results"

It searches for this:
(labelText:riskfoundation/ongoingspecs)

when I click on the link, I get an error that there are no matches

"No results found for (labelText:riskfoundation/ongoingspecs). Please try one of the following suggestions:
Use more general search terms or consult the online documentation for tips.
If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter"

If I modify the search to just say ongoingSpecs, the search will work but then the page will not list the 6 items.

h3. Cause
This occurs because the label macro itself can handle a label containing a "/" character, but when search is invoked it fails.
* This search fails: {{labelText:riskfoundation/ongoingspecs}}, and this is what the macro passes to search when the link is clicked.
* This search works: {{labelText:"riskfoundation/ongoingspecs"}}

h3. Workarounds
# The simplest is to create a new label without the backslash, and use that instead.
# Alternatively when you click on the 'related results' link, you can wrap the label in " characters and the search will succeed.
fields.summary: Content by label - when label has '/' character, when clicking "more" it fails to return 17 items it says are present

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37372].
  {panel}

our system and space CSS definitions are growing and make them hard to maintain manually.
We do have a system-wide CSS. While a space has no CSS itself, it will use the system-wide CSS. Fine.  
Though, many space administrators in our Confluence system wanted small CSS additions for their space which did not make sense to include into the system-wide CSS.
The current implementation of the CSS requires (at least up to 5.4) to copy the whole system-wide CSS to the space, and then add the additional space-specific customizations.

Suggestions:
1. I would prefer if the space-specific CSS would simply overwrite (merge with) the system-wide CSS, so we don't need to repeat them in each space. The pages should first read the system CSS, then the space CSS, then apply the combined content to the pages. This would eliminate a lot of redundant content in the space CSS'.
2. When upgrading from one Confluence release to another, frequently the spelling of CSS has changed. In case they are used in (potentially many) space CSS, all of these CSS need to be updated. In installations with many spaces, this can become a huge amount of work. So I'm looking for an administration tool which allows to add/delete/replace blocks of CSS to all space CSS where certain conditions are met (e..g. the existence of a certain CSS key which has been obsoleted or modified)
fields.summary: Would like to see an admin tool for CSS administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37368].
  {panel}

The following atlassian-plugin web-item adds an icon to the Confluence Page attachments section:

{code}
    <web-item key="my-plugin-attachment-buttons"
              name="web-item: my plugin attachment buttons"
              section="system.attachment"
              weight="10">

        <label key=""/> <!-- empty, display an icon instead -->

        <!-- attachment action icon -->
        <icon height="16" width="16">
            <link>/download/resources/com.my.plugin/icons/whatever-action_16x16.png</link>
        </icon>

        <tooltip key="my.plugin.attachment.i18n.interaction.tooltip.description"/>

        <!-- the link action -->
        <link>
            <![CDATA[/plugins/my-plugin/thing.action?bbq=asdf]]>
        </link>

        <!-- only show the button on attachments which are of our plugin type -->
        <condition class="com.my.plugin.IsMyTypeOfAttachmentCondition"/>
    </web-item>
{code}

As you can see, it contains an icon section, and an empty label. This web-item works perfectly when viewing Confluence page attachments ({{/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=x}}).

However, when a Confluence Attachments macro is added to the Confluence page, the button is rendered incorrectly, with the icon missing.
fields.summary: Confluence Attachments macro does not support icons, despite attachment web-item icons being a valid parameter

If we use the view file macro to insert a Word document with multiple tables under different heading, the tables will not display correctly.

h3. Environment:

h3. Resolution
The new File Preview in Confluence 5.7 does not exhibit this behaviour. You can upgrade to Confluence 5.7, and [insert the files into the page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Displaying+Files+and+Images#DisplayingFilesandImages-DisplayingOfficefilesandPDFs] to use the new File Viewer.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37363].
  {panel}

*Symptom*
You are trying to create a new label for a Confluence Space or page. Confluence does not recognize two words as being together.

*Cause*
Confluence currently does not respect a space between two words to create a multi-word label.

*Current behavior*
'My Label' will create two separate labels. 'My' and 'Label' Currently a user must include a - or _ between the two words to link them as one label.

*Requested behavior*
Encapsulating the label 'My Label' in parenthesis, should be treated as one label. i.e., 'My Label'
fields.summary: Allow multi-word labels within Confluence

I have a Confluence page with multiple Page Properties blocks on it with the same attributes, for example:

|Title|Something or Other|
|Author|Albert|

and

|Title|One more thing|
|Author|Brittany|

And I put a Page Properties Report on the parent page to gather the properties from all child pages.

According to the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Page+Properties+Report+Macro
"Reporting on specific Page Properties macros
You can add multiple Page Properties macros on a page, and choose whether to include all or only specific macros in the report."

I am expecting two rows in my summary table, one for each of those Page Properties blocks. I get only one row (it appears to be the last block on the page?)

There are several defects in this same vein on this site, but they are all marked as closed and resolved in v5.4.4, etc., but under our copy of v5.7, this problem still exists (has returned?)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- You upload three versions of a attachment.
- Then you delete the two latest versions, coming back to the first version.
- The Word preview macro will correctly go back and show the preview of the first version.
- Then you upload a new second version, totally diferent from the other ones.
- The Word preview macro will show the other second version (first one) which has already been deleted.
- Same happens when you upload a third version.
- Downloading the file attached will download the correct file, so the issue is not on the Attachments macro, it is on the Word Preview Macro.

Restarting Confluence doesn't change the sympton.

Customer is running Confluence 5.7.3 and I was able to replicate the same issue on 5.4.1.

The customer recorded a screencast for a better understanding of the issue: https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1127505/1127505_Recording+%231.mp4
fields.summary: Word Preview Macro showing wrong attachments versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user watches a space (and not a page directly), and an attachment is added to a page, there is no notification email sent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.7.x
# Setup the mail server
# Create a space with user A
# Watch the space with user B
# Create a page with user A
** User B will receive a notification email
# Go to ... > Attachments with user A
# Upload an attachment to the page with user A

h3. Expected Results
User B will receive an email notification of the new attachment

h3. Actual Results
User B does not receive an email notification of the new attachment
 
h3. Notes
* This does work as expected in Confluence 5.6.x.
* There are no emails stuck in the mail queue
* There are no errors in the logs generated from this event
fields.summary: Email notifications are not sent to users that watch a space when an attachment is added to a page in Confluence 5.7.x

fields.description:
A page has been deleted. A second page has been created with the same name as the previously deleted page.

The new page links to a third page (in another space). 

If you try to move (using the reorder pages functionality) the third page within its space, this reordering fails. 
The user does not get any error message, but in the logfiles an exception states that:

{code}Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DuplicateDataRuntimeException: A page already exists with the title TITLE in the space with key KEY
{code}

Use the following query to verify the situation:{code}select a.content_status, a.title, b.content_status, b.title, a.spaceid from CONTENT a, CONTENT b where a.SPACEID=b.SPACEID and a.TITLE=b.TITLE and not a.content_status = b.content_status and a.contenttype = b.contenttype;{code}

Workaround: purge the deleted page from the trash.
fields.summary: Moving a page that has incoming links from a page with duplicate entries in content table fails
